intro: Erigeron pseudohyrcanicus, commonly known as the Turkmenian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green, and it produces small blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron pseudohyrcanicus is often found in rocky soils and is a component of steppe and desert ecosystems.
